TITLE: IRS unveils ‘voluntary disclosure program’ for businesses duped by pandemic-era tax credit
SUMMARY: The IRS has unveiled a "voluntary disclosure program" for businesses that claimed a pandemic-era tax credit in error and want to pay the money back.

TITLE: Biden touts minority small business wins as Latino approval sags
SUMMARY: A recent CNBC survey found that Republican front-runner Donald Trump has a 5-point lead against Biden among Latinos.

TITLE: IRS rejects more than 20,000 refund claims for pandemic-related tax credit
SUMMARY: The IRS is sending more than 20,000 rejection letters to taxpayers who wrongly claimed the employee retention tax credit. Here's what filers need to know.

TITLE: Supreme Court hears tax case on 'income': It may 'have the biggest fiscal policy effects of any court decision,' expert says
SUMMARY: The Supreme Court on Tuesday is hearing oral arguments for Moore v. United States, a case that could affect broad swaths of the U.S. tax code.

TITLE: President Biden's approval among small business owners hits new low, as economic message fails to sell on Main Street: CNBC survey
SUMMARY: Add Main Street business owners to Americans not buying President Biden's economic message with his approval among small business owners at a new low.

TITLE: It's TikTok Shop's first Christmas, and shoppers are torn between hot deals and ethics
SUMMARY: As consumers head into the holiday season, a new e-commerce platform has entered the playing field: TikTok Shop.

TITLE: IRS delays tax reporting rule change for business payments on apps such as Venmo and PayPal
SUMMARY: If you received business payments via apps such as PayPal and Venmo, you will not be subject to a lower threshold for 1099-K tax reporting for 2023.

TITLE: More part-time workers to get access to employer retirement plans next year
SUMMARY: Changes in the federal law, coupled with a strong labor market and state mandates are opening up employer-sponsored retirement plans to part-time workers.

TITLE: Mom and pop shops are cutting software spending, creating jitters on Wall Street
SUMMARY: Software vendors that serve small and medium-sized businesses have gotten hammered by investors recently due to concerning forecasts

TITLE: It's open enrollment season for health coverage. If you're self-employed, you can't afford to ignore it
SUMMARY: Critical health insurance coverage decisions for the self-employed and their families need to be made now.

TITLE: Building an e-commerce sales success story is getting more complex and costly
SUMMARY: Amazon is big business for many e-commerce entrepreneurs, but the costs and competition are complex, as the FTC case highlights.

TITLE: On Main Street, it's time to prepare for the new state minimum wage hikes in 2024
SUMMARY: More state-mandated minimum wage hikes are coming in 2024, and many Main Street businesses may feel the pinch.

TITLE: How the cost of homebuying and selling will change after landmark court loss over real estate commissions
SUMMARY: $100 billion in residential real estate commissions paid by American homebuyers and sellers every year is up for grabs as legal pressures mount.

TITLE: How the Biden administration is doing on its goal of getting more loans to minority small business owners
SUMMARY: America is experiencing a small business boom. SBA loans for minority entrepreneurs are a bigger part of the story.

TITLE: Amazon unveils buy now, pay later option from Affirm for small business owners
SUMMARY: Amazon is rolling out its first buy now, pay later checkout option for small business owners via fintech player Affirm, CNBC has learned.

TITLE: The Fed decision on interest rates won't offer much relief to Main Street businesses
SUMMARY: The Fed held rates steady at its FOMC meeting, but small business owners are struggling to access capital, and credit card usage is rising.

TITLE: The last resort of bankruptcy is rising among Main Street businesses across America
SUMMARY: Bankruptcy filings among small businesses are rising, and more owners will face a critical juncture between epic failure and successful rebound positioning.

TITLE: How Innovation Refunds cashed in on the Employee Retention Credit
SUMMARY: Innovation Refunds is among the companies that cashed in on helping small businesses apply for the Employee Retention Credit.

TITLE: 'Bidenomics' on Main Street: Lending to women-owned small businesses tops $5 billion, SBA reports
SUMMARY: SBA-supported lending to women-owned small businesses is up nearly 70% since 2020, reaching over $5 billion in annual loan volume.

TITLE: The next big post-affirmative action legal ruling to drop targets billions in small business contracts
SUMMARY: Small businesses are awarded billions of dollars each year in federal contracts, but social and economic mobility factors are now a target of legal challenges.

TITLE: What to know as IRS kicks off withdrawal option for pandemic-era small business tax credit
SUMMARY: The IRS has announced a special withdrawal process for small businesses that wrongly claimed the employee retention tax credit. Here's what to know.

TITLE: Running a franchise business like fast food is getting more expensive
SUMMARY: McDonald's recent decision to raise fees for fast food franchise owners should be a wake-up call to franchisees that costs are increasing.

TITLE: A big climate change stress test is coming for Amazon sellers and suppliers
SUMMARY: As Amazon and other big companies reduce their carbon footprint, they're putting pressure on suppliers to do the same, or risk losing business.

TITLE: On Amazon, eBay, and Shopify, AI is the new third-party seller
SUMMARY: Purchased an Amazon Prime deal? Maybe an AI wrote the product copy that convinced you to spend. It will be doing more of the pitching.

TITLE: 'Shark Tank' star Daymond John looks to boost Black entrepreneurs for a fourth year
SUMMARY: 'Shark Tank' star Daymond John's Black Entrepreneurs Day will return for a fourth year at the Apollo Theater and in an online stream.

TITLE: Here's how New York City is planning to spend $15 billion raised from a new congestion pricing toll
SUMMARY: NYC's zone-based congestion toll will charge drivers to enter lower Manhattan, which could improve local air quality and fund mass transit improvements.

TITLE: Supreme Court tax case could have sweeping federal policy effects, experts say
SUMMARY: The Supreme Court will soon hear a case that could have sweeping effects on the U.S. tax code, including corporate revenue and future wealth tax proposals.

TITLE: House Republicans push IRS for answers on processing pause for small business tax credit
SUMMARY: House Republicans are pressing the IRS for answers after the agency paused processing new employee retention tax credit claims. Here's what to know.

TITLE: How to buy insurance for a business so financial disaster doesn't strike
SUMMARY: Skimping on property damage and other business insurance coverage is understandable given cost, but in the end owners may pay a much bigger price.

TITLE: AI is policing the package theft beat for UPS as 'porch piracy' surge continues across U.S.
SUMMARY: Companies including UPS and Amazon continue to be challenged by package theft. UPS thinks AI may be the best cop for this crime beat.
